intro: Zexmenia subsericea, commonly known as the slender zexmenia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale green, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Zexmenia subsericea is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forests and undergrowth.
